title: Ashanti announces epic UK tour with Ginuwine and Mario
text:
Roll out the red carpet for Ashanti (Picture: Getty Images)

Prepare to relive the golden era of R&B as Ashanti has announced a UK tour to take place early next year.

Even better, she’s bringing along some of her superstar friends with Ginuwine and Mario coming along to give us the ultimate sense of noughties nostalgia.

The Foolish singer will launch the UK tour in Bristol on 29 January, before moving onto cities like Cardiff, Norwich, Leeds, Nottingham, and Glasgow.

Ashanti and her crew will perform three dates with live bands at Hammersmith’s Eventim Apollo in London on 31 January, BEC Arena in Manchester on 1 February and Birmingham’s O2 Academy on 2 February.

Tickets will be available for presale on Wednesday (23 October) before general sale opens on Friday (25 October).

Basically, you’d be Foolish not to go. Pun very much intended.

Ashanti, 39, was one of R&B’s most prominent darlings in the mid-noughties with hit singles including Foolish, Rock Wit U (Awww Baby), Rain On Me and Only U.

Ginuwine will bring his Pony to the UK stages (Picture: Getty Images)

Mario was an R&B superstar in the noughties (Picture: Getty Images)

In the past year, Ashanti has enjoyed renewed success with her latest single, Pretty Little Thing, which accompanied her endorsement deal for the popular online clothing store.

Hands up who couldn’t stop singing ‘pretty little thing’ all summer when Ashanti’s advert aired during Love Island breaks? Yep, us too.

Thanks to Channing Tatum and the Magic Mike boys, Ginuwine is still able to ride the coattails of his 1996 hit single Pony, which is possibly more relevant than ever. The 49-year-old crooner is also best known for the songs In Those Jeans and Differences, while he also completed a stint in Celebrity Big Brother two years ago.

Mario, 33, burst onto the music scene in 2002 with his infectious single Just A Friend, while his tear-jerker Let Me Love You propelled him to new heights.

It’s safe to say this is one tour not to be missed.
